title: Promoting Competition in the American Economy

enrichment.summary: This executive order directs federal agencies to promote fair competition across the American economy by addressing excessive market concentration, monopolies, and anti-competitive practices. It establishes a White House Competition Council to coordinate government efforts and instructs agencies to review and revise regulations and enforcement actions to better protect workers, small businesses, consumers, and innovation.
potential_concerns: Increased regulatory actions may create burdens for businesses trying to grow or innovate through mergers and acquisitions.
Coordinating multiple agencies with overlapping jurisdictions could lead to bureaucratic inefficiencies or conflicts.
Efforts to curtail non-compete clauses and occupational licensing rules might face strong opposition from industry groups and states.
The broad scope covering diverse sectors poses challenges in aligning enforcement priorities and measuring effectiveness.
Aggressive antitrust actions against large technology firms may have unintended impacts on innovation and consumer choices.
